text.p: These were the main headlines from Lithuania's M-1 plus radio station's news report on Friday afternoon. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Euro-sceptic Rimantas Smetona, who is supported by the National Democratic Movement for an Independent Lithuania, has decided to run for president in the December 21 elections. He said that Lithuania is being dragged into the European Union, which will have a negative impact on its economy.

- The general director of the Butinge Nafta oil terminal, Vladislovas Gedvilas, said that the $104 million in government guarantees for loans for the project will pay for only half of its construction costs and will scare foreign investors.
- The general meeting of Lithuanian judges takes place in Vilnius on Friday. They plan to discuss the reform of Lithuanian courts, judicial ethics and changes and amendments to the law on courts.
